newsitem.title: FRANCE: Metaleurop restarts Nordenham lead plant.
newsitem.headline: Metaleurop restarts Nordenham lead plant.

text.p: Metals firm Metaleurop said on Wednesday it was restarting its Nordenham lead smelter in Germany.
"We are restarting the plant today as planned," a company spokeswoman told Reuters.
Metaleurop, a subsidiary of Preussag, announced in late July it was closing down the smelter to make technical modifications.
Metaleurop had said it planned to restart lead production at the plant in early September.
The smelter started producing lead in March.
Metaleurop had said output at the new 90,000 tonnes plant was to be limited to 70 percent of capacity during the first 12 months of operation.
The spokeswoman said the company planned to release new production data next week.
Because of recurring technical problems Nordenham had been producing less lead than initially expected.
Asked if this meant Nordenham would not meet its initial output target for the first 12 of operation, she said, "We should be below."
Deliveries to customers were not affected by the closure because Metaleurop was able to secure lead mainly from its Noyelle-Godault plant in France.
